summary: Build an AI-powered IQ testing website named "High IQ".
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- High IQ app icon, flat vector/mark style, transparent background (high-iq-app-icon.dim_192x192.png)
- High IQ app icon, flat vector/mark style, transparent background (high-iq-app-icon.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core app shell for a website named “High IQ”, including a public landing page and an authenticated experience using Internet Identity.
Implement an “AI-like” adaptive IQ test flow (no external AI/LLM services) that selects questions based on user performance and computes a final IQ-style score with a short textual summary.
Create the main UI pages/components: Landing, Test (question display + answer selection + progress), Results (score + breakdown), and History (list of previous test attempts).
Establish a coherent, distinctive visual theme for “High IQ” and apply it consistently across all pages (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling). Avoid a blue/purple palette.
Generate and include static brand imagery for the app (logo and a simple hero illustration) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image serving).
Add Progressive Web App (PWA) support so the “High IQ” site is installable in Chrome (desktop + Android) and behaves like an app (standalone window) when installed.
Implement an app icon set suitable for Chrome install prompts and store listing, and ensure the manifest references the generated icon files.
Add a service worker to enable basic offline support for the app shell (landing page + core JS/CSS) so the installed app launches reliably even with intermittent connectivity.

Add a short “Chrome install / publish” documentation file explaining how to (1) install locally in Chrome, (2) package the build for distribution, and (3) submit the PWA to the Chrome Web Store (steps only; no external integrations).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an AI-powered IQ testing website ("High IQ")
Add a backend data model and API for: a built-in question bank with difficulty levels, per-user test sessions, recorded answers, and stored completed results so users can view past attempts.
Publish/distribute the "High IQ" app for Chrome (e.g., package for Chrome and publish via Chrome Web Store or otherwise make it installable/accessible in Chrome).
